context: The Estonian verb 'sõitma' is an infinitive form that means to travel, go by vehicle, or drive/ride. It can refer to various modes of transportation including cars, bikes, buses, etc. The verb follows Estonian conjugation patterns and changes its ending depending on the subject and tense. For example: ma sõidan (I go/drive), sa sõidad (you go/drive), ta sõidab (he/she/it goes/drives).
